data.name: Better Me Kenya
data.overview: {"blocks":[{"key":"am1bn","text":"A Better World starts with a Better Me","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":38,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ju6p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i44o","text":"MISSION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":7,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9tl","text":"We empower vulnerable Children & Youth with Education, Training and Life Skills to co-create a Better World.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j0v1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4iln9","text":"VISION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":6,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4g1vq","text":"We work to co+create a world of self-responsible, compassionate and curious human beings who work together to strengthen life in ALL forms.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ek4q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ckuc","text":"PROGRAMS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":8,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mktk","text":"While providing children and youth in Kenya with access to education and training, our programs use the universal languages of art and play to instill kindness, compassion and curiosity. We see Kenya’s new generation as facilitators of positive change and our mission is to empower them with skills and tools to develop righteous hearts and strong mindsets to bring about positive change for themselves and their communities.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpd7p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gq6p","text":"#1 Children and Youth Support","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":29,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9367e","text":"We provide access to primary education by supporting the Korando Educational Centre and other projects in the Kisumu slums.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":11,"length":27,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59onj","text":"We provide access to high-school education with our bursary program.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":10,"length":32,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3b7vf","text":"We run mentorship programs to develop youth life skills and provide emotional wellness in schools around Kisumu.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":7,"length":19,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":44,"length":11,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":68,"length":19,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i0b6","text":"#2 Support for Grassroots Organizations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":39,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8a734","text":"We support local organizations and projects in the community, using our resources such as mentorship, counseling, training and other human resources to build capacity.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":11,"length":49,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g1vg","text":"We support our partners to build functional organizational structures, raise awareness, increase their impact and build a network of partners and donors.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":27,"length":82,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"784qm","text":"#3 Advocacy for Children & Youth Support","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":40,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kdvg","text":"We create spaces for dialogue with the Department of Children Services, the Department of Youth and Gender Services and the Ministry of Education, to supplement their efforts in supporting Kenyan children and youth.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":3,"length":26,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":39,"length":10,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":124,"length":21,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3qss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0mhn","text":"Thank you for your support. You rock!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eoc7r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5ph0","text":"Powered by love.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":16,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

data.name: Anna's Pals
data.overview: {"blocks":[{"key":"6keg","text":"Anna’s Pals is a registered 501c3 charity that was established six years ago with the mission of enriching the lives of hospitalized children and their families in and around the Boston area, while also providing funding for research associated with childhood cancers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

data.name: Women's Empowerment International
data.overview: {"blocks":[{"key":"toes","text":"Women’s Empowerment International (WE) is on a mission to empower women with the tools to work their way out of poverty, care for their families, and strengthen their communities. We envision a world without poverty in which women are empowered, uplifted and equal partners in society. Women live in safe, sustainable environments that include adequate food, water, housing, education, and health care and are free from gender-based violence. They have the hope, opportunity, and ability to control their lives and futures.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68fvk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6si2r","text":"WE funds microfinance programs, small business development support, training, education, and other holistic poverty alleviation strategies benefitting thousands of women experiencing poverty around the world. WE currently funds eight programs in five countries including the U.S and Puerto Rico, Mexico, Honduras, Haiti and Uganda. Focusing on the most under-resourced communities, WE enables women entrepreneurs to build their skills, obtain small business loans, and launch sustainable income-generating enterprises that serve their families, villages, and communities.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

data.name: Kashmir Humanity Foundation
data.overview: Kashmir Humanity Foundation KHF India mission is to educate the poor and the other half is to educate the world about the poor. Our vision is to strive for a world of leaders and citizens who have interacted with, and are truly knowledgeable about the world's poor.

data.name: Yellow Boat of Hope Foundation
data.overview: {"blocks":[{"key":"a0lai","text":"The Yellow Boat of Hope Foundation (formerly Philippine Funds for Little Kids) began from a single social media post, “wow…kids swim 2km to school!!!”, after being told and eventually witnessing the determination of the children in the mangrove village of Layag-Layag, Brgy. Talon-Talon, Zamboanga City to go to school.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14ani","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kgoc","text":"Aware of the dangers on their path to acquire education, these children tirelessly swim across bodies of water and walk several kilometers through sand and mud with the hope of someday changing the lives of their families into something better.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gq1r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cr","text":"As a response, we decided to start a fundraising effort and pooled our resources to fund the Yellow Boat Project to help these children get to school fast, safe, and dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ribk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea2c7","text":"What we initially thought was a one-time project turned out to be our life-long mission.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ukn9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cl288","text":"We believe that education is the only way and hope of these children and their families to escape poverty. If kids can keep going to school, things can change.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3l76b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7em8n","text":"With the help of our partners, Hope Paddlers, and volunteers, our Yellow Boat Project has snowballed into a much bigger advocacy to effect lasting changes and improvement to the lives of the communities.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90t9v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cddsk","text":"From one humble yellow boat with the words “Bagong Pag-Asa” (New Hope) imprinted on its body, we are now building classrooms, dormitories, bridges, and community learning centers;and also providing scholarships, school supplies, and medical and dental missions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"j2ei","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efa0u","text":"We conduct feeding programs as well to make it easier for kids to stay in school, and livelihood projects to help parents sustain their kids’ education.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aker4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"613su","text":"Our Yellow Boat Project has sailed countless journeys, touched many lives, and continues to ferry thousands of children to school every day to pave a brighter future for them. Furthermore, we have created more initiatives to uplift the lives of entire communities. These are the Yellow School Boat Project, Adopt-a-Fisherman Project, Yellow School of Hope, Yellow Dorm of Hope, Yellow Boat ALS Karunungan, Yellow Boat Adventures, Yellow Bridge of Hope, Week Without Walls, Yellow Boat E-Hubs, and Seeds of Hope among others.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7oucl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlpnb","text":"Amazingly, with the help of the Almighty, our sponsors, and the unwavering volunteerism of our Hope Paddlers, we continue to bring “Bagong Pag-Asa” to where it is needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3cni","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"o08c","text":"We can get there faster if we all work together and help each other. No amount of donation or effort is too small to make a change… because it only takes one person who cares to make a difference.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8agpg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4b371","text":"Come paddle with us until no kid is left behind… one Yellow Boat at a time. #HopeSails","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"934p6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1j0ll","text":"PS - You can learn more about us by visiting https://www.yellowboat.org.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

data.name: Marine Megafauna Foundation
data.overview: The Marine Megafauna Foundation is saving ocean giants from extinction. We work around the world, from Florida in the USA to Flores in Indonesia, to protect endangered marine wildlife.

data.name: Sumarth
data.overview: Headquartered in Bihar India, Sumarth supports over 15000 farmers in their economic growth by providing a 360-degree agricultural and technical solution. From crop planning to ensured market linkage in agriculture. Its core area is market linked profitable agriculture with an objective to make agriculture effortless, profitable and less risky. This includes investigating how blockchain solutions can aid this process on the ground as well as financially.

data.name: Cod Nerc
data.overview: Empower the people and impart a feeling of ownership towards their well-being and welfare so that the people themselves could take initiative to maintain their overall living condition.

data.name: Southern Highlands Participatory Organisation
data.overview: We are a Tanzanian NGO based in Njombe and operates throughout the Tanzanian mainland. Our NGO is specializing in Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH), Microfinance, Agriculture and Irrigation and having more than 12 years of experience working in rural communities by facilitating projects based on the priorities, needs and capacities of rural communities as well as the private sector.

data.name: Bumi Sehat Foundation International
data.overview: {"blocks":[{"key":"3iiov","text":"Bumi Sehat Foundation operates four Community Health, Education and Childbirth Centers in Indonesia and (jointly) one in the Phillippines. Our by-donation services include infant, child and family health services, maternal health: pre and post-natal care, breastfeeding support, nutritional education, pre-natal yoga and gentle, loving natural birth services. We offer youth skills training and scholarships for poor Indonesians to become medical workers or teachers. Bumi Sehat also has trained, experienced teams that provide medical relief & logistics in post-disaster areas across the country.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

data.name: Rizoma Foundation
data.overview:
Rizoma, or Rhizome (in English), is a “a continuously growing horizontal underground stem that puts out lateral shoots and adventitious roots at intervals” (1). In the Philosophy of Gilles Deleuze and Felix Guattari, a rhizome is “non-hierarchical, heterogeneous, multiplicitous, and acentered” (2).



The Rizoma Foundation is a place that seeks to put forward ideas about a future that is not only sustainable, but regenerative. A place to consider resilient paths toward the future. The central principle guiding our work is how to make the human and natural world healthier and more diverse, which includes social equality, freedom and tolerance.



We consider both the challenges we face in the social, ecological, economic and political realms, and then we consider a diverse set of solutions to those presented problems. We draw from ancient ideas and practices through modern inventions. No idea is off limits for discussion and debate in order to reach the ultimate goal of making and re-making a sustainable future.



Working from the idea that the development of solutions must take place in context, Rizoma Foundation seeks accelerate ethically-driven, grounded initiatives in order to facilitate meaningful long-term changes in thinking and behaviors for the world. The ultimate goal is that projects supported by Rizoma Foundation can help to provide a foundational toolkit with which they can navigate the development of further solutions.

data.name: Asia Pacific Transgender Network
data.overview:
The Asia Pacific Transgender Network is a trans led organization working to advance the rights of trans and gender diverse people across the Asia Pacific region through reserach, policy and advocacy.

APTN works with a range of partners, globally and across Asia and the Pacific, to support, organize, and advocate for comprehensive healthcare and the protection of legal, social, and human rights for trans and gender diverse people. These collaborators include trans communities, academia, the health sector, multilateral and bilateral agencies, governmental organisations and NGOs, donors, and other stakeholders.

Since its founding in 2009, APTN has published several key reports, policy and technical briefs, in partnership with other community-based groups and multilateral organisations, that have been used to inform policy and laws.

data.name: The Biodiversity Group
data.overview: {"blocks":[{"key":"3rm0g","text":"The Biodiversity Group protects the species and habitats that other organizations neglect—the conservation underdogs and what they term Life Overlooked™. For over two decades its programs have been delivering insights and discoveries that have led to protections for some of the most overlooked wildlife on our planet. Harnessing the lessons and resources from this long track record of success, they have recently scaled their efforts to help other nonprofits—efforts which are now making waves in the conservation space.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

data.name: The Turing Trust
data.overview: The Turing Trust supports education in sub-Saharan Africa by reusing computers and improving teacher training using ICT. We provide skills development in the UK while reducing waste and contributing to an environmentally friendly society.

data.name: Childreach Nepal
data.overview:
Childreach Nepal strongly believes that all children in Nepal should have access to education, healthcare, protection and most importantly an opportunity for meaningful participation. It uses holistic development approaches where children are not objects but active agents of their own development. It also acknowledges the role of the community in learning and development of children. Childreach Nepal strives to create schools as centers for children and community development. For implementing this approach the strategies, it has adopted includes safeguarding child protection, knowledge creation and sharing best practice models and adding value to government policies and initiatives. It is envisioned that through these means Childreach Nepal will be able to bring about the changes in the lives of children and community in its target areas.

Our Vision
A world where all children have the opportunity to fulfill their potential in life.

Our Mission
To improve children’s access to education, health care and child protection and to restore child rights, empowering resilient children to create positive change through community-based solutions.

Our Values

Integrity
We work with fairness and honesty to maintain the credibility of the organisation and its activities, holding ourselves accountable to the highest standards in all that we do.

Passion
Our absolute belief in child rights is at the heart of our work. We are dedicated, motivated and endlessly enthusiastic about helping communities to help themselves.

Teamwork
Childreach Nepal is a family. To Get Things Done we rely on mutual support, collaboration and cooperation both internally and with all our valued partners.

Human-centered
Our projects are co-designed and implemented with our community partners in a single rural municipality. We bring empathy and compassion to recognize, value and include the needs and ideas of each and every individual.

Inclusion
Celebrating diversity enables us to create, support and promote equitable opportunities for every child within our partner communities.

Empowerment
Children should be seen and heard. Our work helps them find autonomy, confidence and the self-determination and voice needed to articulate and claim their own rights.

Innovation
Optimistic experimentation is crucial to the success and growth of our projects and our organisation. Thinking creatively leads to better solutions that transform lives.

Learning
Education is a right that doesn’t end in school. As a learning organisation, we embrace our failures as well as our successes and see every lesson as an opportunity for improvement.

Approach
We are a grassroots organisation working very closely with communities in a single rural municipality, Paanch Pokhari Thangpal GaunPalika in Sindupalchok, likewise we also work in the districts of Dolakha, Kavre and Bhaktapur. We engage deeply with our community partners, using human-centered methods of participatory inquiry to identify the challenges they face in keeping their children healthy, safe and in school. We work with them to identify and explore potential solutions, and help provide access to the resources and expertise that they need in order to own and implement these plans.

We are proud that this work, although often complex to quantify and measure, brings about long term sustainable change.

data.name: Impact Marathon
data.overview:
The Impact Marathon Foundation catalyses change across the world, bringing organisations together and unleashing the power of running to uplift communities and empower individuals. 

We create marathon races that engage the runners directly with the projects on the frontlines of the Sustainable Development Goals. From Quality Education in Nepal, to Zero Hunger in Malawi, to Reduced Inequalities in Guatemala and Life on Land in Scotland. In each country, our races act as a conduit to new partnerships between public, private and third sector to catalyse their goals through our platform.

In 6 years, we have raised over $1.2m for over 20 grassroots organisations through Impact Runner Fundraising. Each organisation then has the opportunity to directly engage with those fundraisers and that can mean direct implementation of the funds, the creation of story-telling content and connecting with new corporate partners. 

We focus all our efforts on being the grant-makers that charities dream of. Supportive, pro-active and unrestricted. We have built the platform through our races, how can they unleash the power of running to achieve their goals?

data.name: Espaco Voa
data.overview: {"blocks":[{"key":"34ana","text":"Espaco Voa is a living environment where families, educators, collaborators, and children receive tools to move between self-knowledge, transformation, and connection, making the creative potential within each one of us express itself and promote an integral, autonomous, respectful, and meaningful learning. In agile learning, we believe that our commitment and dedication to knowledge are potentiated when we follow what moves us and what makes sense.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

data.name: SAMEO
data.overview: SAMEO has set up collaborations with intra and inter-countries, academic institutions, and NGOs in SAMEO region to assess various regional issues around maternal and child morbidity and death rate.

data.name: Pro2Tect
data.overview: Pro2tect is saving our oceans through cleanups and trash removal.

data.name: Gomde UK
data.overview: Our outer environmental activity is to protect, promote and improve the rich and rare biodiversity and ecology at Lindholme Hall Estate and surrounding wetlands through sustainable management. Our inner environment activity is to not harm other beings , help them if we can, and tame our own mind by meditation, study and reflection on the teachings of the Buddha.

data.name: Save the Waves
data.overview: {"blocks":[{"key":"cnv0p","text":"Save The Waves Coalition's mission is to protect surf ecosystems around the globe. A surf ecosystem is more than just a wave: it includes the plants and animals unique to the place, the geophysical components that contribute to a breaking wave, and the individuals who depend on the place for their livelihoods and wellbeing. We take a unique approach to protecting coastlines and surf through our pillars of Protect, Steward, and Defend. We believe that legally protected areas, effective stewardship and a mobilized constituency result in healthy and thriving surf ecosystems. Our greatest strength lies in our ability to build strong coalitions starting at the grassroots in surf communities. Supporting this work is our deep knowledge of economics in surf communities. The combination of these has supported our 11 World Surfing Reserves (WSRs) - a network of voluntary protected areas around the world’s best surfing locations - and our Surf Protected Area Networks (SPANs) to protect thousands of acres of biodiverse coastal and marine ecosystems.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

data.name: Global Synergy for Leadership
data.overview: {"blocks":[{"key":"3tqhu","text":"Global Synergy for Leadership is non-profit created in 2011 on the idea that an empowered young person is the pillar on which the future can be built. That is why for the past 10 years we have been focusing on bringing leadership and entrepreneurship skills to young women and men in the rural DR Congo and other East and West African countries. Our vision is to promote in Africa a Leadership that supports peace building, justice, development, human dignity, democracy and the protection of the environment. Our mission is to work with our community in an empowering partnership.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

data.name: Territorio de Zaguates
data.overview: {"blocks":[{"key":"se95","text":"We are a dog sanctuary in the mountains of Costa Rica. For the past 30 years, we have rescued & neutered thousands of strays. Currently, we are a home for more than 1800 dogs searching for a family. We help them get adopted and accept them in our pack until they find a second chance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

data.name: Community Action for Sustainable Development Sierra Leone (CASD - SL)
data.overview: {"blocks":[{"key":"4rdsg","text":"Community Action for Sustainable Development Sierra Leone is a grassroot youth and women empowerment organization. We analyze community problems and design inclusive solutions that tackle the Sustainable Development Goals.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

data.name: Water for Africa
data.overview: Water for Africa is UK based charity that specialises in providing clean water, sanitation and basic healthcare within Africa. We believe that to tackle endemic poverty within Africa you must first tackle the issue of clean sustainable water. Having worked nearly 10 years in the field of ground water resource management within Africa, Water for Africa has helped many International NGOs, Charities, and villages to provide clean sustainable water for their projects. We drill boreholes with our own drilling rigs and our own fully trained in-country drillers. We also offer consultancy services on the best practises of sustainable ground water resource management within Africa.
